parameter 1: In syndication and daytime network repeats, the tag sequences were usually cut.
parameter 2: In the United States it ran for 63 episodes. The DVD version in the United States has 63 episodes. In Spain it ran a shortened version with 13 episodes.
parameter 3: There is an alternate version of the pilot episode on the DVD set with a different narration voice, with some additional or different scenes (at the beginning: Kyle naked in the woods/ the breakfast scene/ Nicole says goodbye to an autistic patient/ at the party: the policeman is threatening Kyles/ at the end: Lou can not find Kyle's file) and some scenes are gone (Kyle naked in the city/ Declan in Lori's bed). The alternate version is 30 seconds shorter than the original pilot and has no credits, neither at the beginning nor the end.
parameter 4: In syndication and daytime network repeats, the tag sequences were usually cut.

parameter 6: The storytelling intro, seen at the beginning of every French episode, is not present on the Region 1 DVD version.
parameter 7: There is an alternate version of the pilot episode on the DVD set with a different narration voice, with some additional or different scenes (at the beginning: Kyle naked in the woods/ the breakfast scene/ Nicole says goodbye to an autistic patient/ at the party: the policeman is threatening Kyles/ at the end: Lou can not find Kyle's file) and some scenes are gone (Kyle naked in the city/ Declan in Lori's bed). The alternate version is 30 seconds shorter than the original pilot and has no credits, neither at the beginning nor the end.
parameter 8: The DVDs are uncensored, mostly revolving around racy scenes NBC couldn't air.
parameter 9: The DVD release of the series will include footage not originally broadcast.
parameter 10: In the United States it ran for 63 episodes. The DVD version in the United States has 63 episodes. In Spain it ran a shortened version with 13 episodes.
parameter 11: In syndication and daytime network repeats, the tag sequences were usually cut.
parameter 12: Originally broadcast in Canada as "Nikita". Rebroadcasts in the US make use of the film title "La Femma Nikita." In 2001, new episodes were broadcast as "Nikita" while reruns were shown as "La Femme Nikita."
parameter 13: At the start of every episode in the original French version, the Bellflower family hears stories of their past adventures from Papa Bramble, who has an old photo album to guide them through. However, such scenes are cut from the Region 1 DVDs of the first season.
parameter 14: Starting in March 2008, the American Life TV Network has aired second season prints that use the first season's theme music in the main title sequence while retaining the second season title's visuals.
parameter 15: The DVD release of the series will include footage not originally broadcast.
parameter 16: The version released on video in Scandinavia has been cut and runs approx. 2 1/2 hours, and goes under the title "Space Island".
parameter 17: There is an edited for DVD version of 170 minutes, published in Germany, October 16, 2009.
